Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Azure Search] Design easier index rebuild process" (#7221) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We will have an "a" and "b" instance of Catalog2AzureSearch and Owners2AzureSearch per region and environment. One will be "live" meaning that it is working against the index that production traffic is going to. One will be "new" meaning that it has no production traffic yet and is the target for the rebuilt.

The idea is similar to the secret rotation process where one thing is active and one is waiting to be used.

The goals:

1. Documented process so anyone on the team can easily follow it
1. Services should never run from a CMD window from an remote desktop session.
1. Remote desktop in general should be minimal.
1. There should be a Git and VSRM trail of changes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MonitoringProcessor can overwrite status blobs" (#7254) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
`MonitoringProcessor` doesn't use ETags, so if the same package is being validated by two threads or separate instances at the same time, there is a chance that they could save at the same time and one run could overwrite the other.

This is possible with both a single instance handling multiple queue messages for the same package as well as with multiple instances handling these messages.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "V3 metadata monitoring: monitoring2monitoring (requeuing job) adds duplicate messages to the queue" (#5710) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
`Monitoring2Monitoring`, a job that requeues packages that failed validation to be revalidated, runs every 10 minutes and requeues every package that is in the failed the state.

This can lead to a problem if the monitoring queue has too many packages in it and `MonitoringProcessor` does not have enough time to process the entire queue in the 10 minutes between runs of `Monitoring2Monitoring`. `Monitoring2Monitoring` will requeue regardless of whether or not the invalid packages it is queuing have been requeued, so if `MonitoringProcessor` has not yet finished the queue and the queue contains requeued messages, there will be duplicate messages in the queue. `MonitoringProcessor` does not do any de-duping of messages (if it sees two messages for the same package/catalog entry it will process both) so it will process these messages multiple times. Unfortunately, this duplicate message effect can snowball out of control very quickly, especially if it happens at the same time as a large number of package pushes.

![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/58054e1495e42b6c5baa9ebb/554c4944-3b6a-4c2e-a3b2-2ef7cf1ea632)

A couple proposed solutions:
1) `Monitoring2Monitoring` should somehow be aware of what's in the queue and only requeue packages that aren't
2) `Monitoring2Monitoring` should only requeue when the number of packages in the queue is low or should requeue less frequently when there are a large amount of packages in the queue.
3) `MonitoringProcessor` should de-dupe messages to revalidate packages that have already succeeded, or require some amount of time has passed before it will revalidate a valid package.

Personally I think 2 would be the easiest implementation for the highest payoff. Requiring there to be less than 10 packages in the queue or so would make it impossible to have more than 10 plus the number of invalid packages in the queue at once.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Plugins:  cache file is never read" (#8210) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
[Plugin cache files](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/NuGet-cross-plat-authentication-plugin#avoid-instantiating-the-plugins-frequently) are never read by the product.  [`PluginCacheEntry.LoadFromFile()`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/9eadc8b83f096ec0a1eca7e61bc42011155a72bf/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Plugins/PluginCacheEntry.cs#L44) has test coverage but is never called by product code.

CC @nkolev92

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Plugins:  "A task was canceled." errors with authentication plugin during restore" (#8198) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Build:  build.ps1 fails by default if select strong name verifications are enabled" (#8196) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: The current behavior is a result of [this change](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/2863/files#diff-f0e02e42e53ec40f5d3b8bed031ad09eR24).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Allow restore to work OOB for .proj too in addition to .msbuildproj" (#8212) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently, [NuGet hardcodes knowledge](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Build.Tasks/NuGet.targets#L236-L237) of the `.msbuildproj` (and `.nuproj`) project file extensions to enable restore to work automatically.

The `.proj` file extension is also (maybe even more?) common in MSBuild project files, and should likely also be enabled by default.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unhandled exception on restoring packages when local package source directory missing" (#8211) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Unhandled exception on restoring packages when a package source fails but one succeeds.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS Mac all versions.

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): All versions (NuGet 5.0 and 4.8).

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate): VS Mac 8.0 and 8.1

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Mac

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1) In VS Mac, create a new C# class library.
2) Install Xamarin.Forms from NuGet.
3) Ensure 2 NuGet package sources are enabled - one can get nuget.org - but one must be a directory on the local machine that does not contain any NuGet packages.
4) Delete the local package source folder from disk.
5) Right click the Packages folder and select Restore.
6) IDE log shows an unhandled exception: 

An unhandled exception has occurred. Terminating Visual Studio? False
NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.FatalProtocolException: Package 'Xamarin.Forms.4.0.0.482894' is not found on source '/directory/does/not/exist'.
  at NuGet.PackageManagement.PackageDownloader.GetDownloadResourceResultAsync (NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.SourceRepository sourceRepository, NuGet.Packaging.Core.PackageIdentity packageIdentity, NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageDownloadContext downloadContext, System.String globalPackagesFolder, NuGet.Common.ILogger logger, System.Threading.CancellationToken token) [0x00220] in <2b7f107a44964c6ca9af39cad04994fb>:0 

## Other suggested things

Looking at the NuGet code my guess is that the local source task fails first, since local package sources are used first, and is added to this failedTasks, and removed from the main tasks list.

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3803820961f4d61c06d07b179dab1d0439ec0d91/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/PackageDownloader.cs#L168

After that the main package source nuget.org succeeds and that task is returned here:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3803820961f4d61c06d07b179dab1d0439ec0d91/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/PackageDownloader.cs#L160

Since the main tasks list does not contain the failed task its exceptions are not observed here:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3803820961f4d61c06d07b179dab1d0439ec0d91/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/PackageDownloader.cs#L145

The failed failedTasks exceptions are only observed if all package sources fail at the end of this method:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/3803820961f4d61c06d07b179dab1d0439ec0d91/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.PackageManagement/PackageDownloader.cs#L185

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

### Sample Project

Very helpful if you can zip a project and paste into this issue!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet 4.9 seems to ignore fallback folders when restoring" (#7628) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe):

NuGet version (4.9.1 and 4.9.2):

dotnet.exe --version: 2.1.302

VS version: N/A

OS version: macOS 10.13.6

Mono: 5.18.0.209 (2018-08/7b9d9b3f1ba Tue Nov 20 07:04:23 EST 2018)

MSBuild: 16.0.40-preview+g105cb8a157 for Mono

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 4.8.1

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

It seems that NuGet 4.9 does not consider the fallback folders defined by the .NET Core sdk. This results in NuGet going online and downloading .nupkgs. NuGet 4.8.1 and nuget 4.7 which ships with Mono 5.18 currently do not do this. This is also affecting Visual Studio for Mac when it is using NuGet 4.9.

nuget.exe taken from nuget.org/downloads

Repro steps:

~/.config/NuGet/NuGet.Config has main nuget.org source enabled but no fallback folders.
Open a terminal window.
mkdir dotnet
cd dotnet
nuget locals all -clear
dotnet new console
ls ~/.nuget/packages
    Folder does not exist.
nuget locals all -clear
mono path/to/nuget.exe restore dotnet.csproj

You would think if I created a package with their own tools it would work...

## Details about Problem

Nuget Package explorer (4.4.3+g7cd7607902)
Nuget Package manager (4.6.0) 
Visual Studio 2017 Pro (15.7.4)
Windows 10 pro

No; I have never got the PackageReference method to work. (Unless running VS as Admin, may require a reload of sol/project)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget list & add commands are being deprecated in 5.0" (#34) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Tracking Issue(s):
* Deprecate ambiguous nuget.exe commands in 5.0 [#7753](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7753)
  * Deprecate nuget.exe add command [#7923](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7923)
  * Rename nuget.exe list to nuget.exe search [#7912](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7912)

The following commands are being deprecated because these are cause of confusion due to their nomenclature and/or other related commands that already exist:
* [`nuget list`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-list): Currently displays a list of packages from a given source
  * This will be replaced by an equivalent command **`nuget search`** which will be later enhanced with more capabilities as we make progress with or [search improvements](nvmd got it: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/6371​​​​​​​).
* [`nuget add`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-add): Currently adds a specified package to a non-HTTP package source (a folder or UNC path) in a hierarchical layout, wherein folders are created for the package ID and version number. 
  * This will be replaced by overloading **`nuget push`** command.

> These commands will be deprecated i.e. there will be a warning on usage of these commands in 5.0 so that in future releases these commands can be discontinued.
